originalText.text: My son attended the 143rd Street location of LROS from when he was a baby until he started 3K. The owner, Christina, was super communicative and truly devoted to the kids. She and her staff provided a safe and loving environment and supported my son through so many milestones from walking to eating to talking. They provided healthy, home cooked meals, which was a real lifesaver for busy parents. My son loved going to daycare every day and I highly recommend LROS!

text.text: My son attended the 143rd Street location of LROS from when he was a baby until he started 3K. The owner, Christina, was super communicative and truly devoted to the kids. She and her staff provided a safe and loving environment and supported my son through so many milestones from walking to eating to talking. They provided healthy, home cooked meals, which was a real lifesaver for busy parents. My son loved going to daycare every day and I highly recommend LROS!

originalText.text:
We started at little rays in March, when I returned to work, my son was 5 months at the time and had been exclusively breastfed and I'd never left him. The thought of transitioning him to daycare was stressful and daunting.  We were on the waiting list for another daycare center and I just had a feeling it wasn't the right place for us. Luckily I met another parent at a local cafe and she recommended LROS. I knew it was the right place after I met Christina (virtually) and got to hear their approach to care.

The first week was tough for my son, he wouldn't take a bottle and cried a lot. Christina and the staff were so patient and worked with me to help my baby. They recommended different bottles, consulted me on things I can do at home to help the transition. It really felt like a team effort to transition successfully. I was really worried that we would not be accepted because my baby was struggling at first, but that couldn't be further from the truth.

Now 4 months later, my son loves going in, he is smiling when I pick him up! LROS have supported our transition to solids, being loving and patient through teething. I honestly just feel like they're family and I can't say enough positive things about them. The kids learn ABCs, counting, sign language, crafts, singing, etc! I love that my baby is interacting with kids his age, but also older, I think that's helping his development. They take the kids outside to the park every day and send us pictures which I love! Lastly, I love that the staff cook on site for the kids, and they have family style meals around the table. It's a bilingual center which is excellent for baby development too and as a single language household, I'm so grateful that he has this exposure at daycare.

I hope this helps other parents looking for a daycare, there are so many options and it's a big decision to trust other people with your baby!

originalText.text: Our daughter attended Little Rays of Sunshine from 6 months old and we were extremely happy with the care and service we received. It's clear that the staff love what they do and treat every child like a member of the family. In addition to the quality care, they provide fresh and healthy meals each day. But perhaps the best indicator of a job well done is the joy on my daughter's face when she arrives each day and sees the team and her friends at LROS.

originalText.text: LROS has been fantastic for my son. Christina and her team are wonderful and they are very on top of things with the kids and their curriculum. They're also very willing to work with us when he is going through development changes, shifts in naps, etc. Our son started when he was just shy of 1yr.

originalText.text:
As a new mom, the start of parenthood started tricker than most. In the middle of the pandemic, we were tasked to find a caretaker for our 3 month old son as I was headed back to work.

Our original search started with Nannies, as we were trying to be extra careful. However, our plans changed when we were able to find, what became our sons home away from home.

Little Rays of Sunshine quickly became a safe haven for our family. From the moment that we started, they were able to meet all of our sons need. Earlier on, they were accommodating to his feeding schedules, as I was still breastfeeding, and the caretakers were elemental to him reaching his early milestones.  In addition, their attention to a healthy environment sealed the deal for us.

As he grew, the staff has educated my son with some critical life skills that he will take with him in the future (such as common courtesy, sharing and picking up after himself).   This is in part to their consistent program of: play, reading, eating all together, nap and creative activities.

The owner, Christina, has made it her mission to ensure that every child is getting the best experience and that parents feel at ease that their child is in the hands of professionals who understand children’s needs.

For me, as a Latina woman, I am proud to support a latino business who is putting their own grain of sand in our community and children. In addition I am proud to say that at two and half my son knows how to speak Spanish and English.

Without any hesitation, I would recommend Little Rays of Sunshine.

Our original search started with Nannies, as we were trying to be extra careful. However, our plans changed when we were able to find, what became our sons home away from home.

Little Rays of Sunshine quickly became a safe haven for our family. From the moment that we started, they were able to meet all of our sons need. Earlier on, they were accommodating to his feeding schedules, as I was still breastfeeding, and the caretakers were elemental to him reaching his early milestones.  In addition, their attention to a healthy environment sealed the deal for us.

As he grew, the staff has educated my son with some critical life skills that he will take with him in the future (such as common courtesy, sharing and picking up after himself).   This is in part to their consistent program of: play, reading, eating all together, nap and creative activities.

The owner, Christina, has made it her mission to ensure that every child is getting the best experience and that parents feel at ease that their child is in the hands of professionals who understand children’s needs.

For me, as a Latina woman, I am proud to support a latino business who is putting their own grain of sand in our community and children. In addition I am proud to say that at two and half my son knows how to speak Spanish and English.

Without any hesitation, I would recommend Little Rays of Sunshine.
